case_vignette:
A 34-year-old male presents with history of itching all over the body ongoing for the past year. He does not take any medications other than multivitamins. He denies any history of skin conditions. He has tried fexofenadine in the past which helped, but over the counter hydrocortisone only provides minimal relief. Pruritus is worse around areas of tight clothing contacting his skin that occurs within a few minutes. Skin examination reveals linear urticaria on the upper back that develop after two minutes in areas of gentle scratching with a cotton tip applicator.  The patient is a non-smoker and has no history of allergies.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing itching all over my body for the past year.
Have you noticed any changes on your skin like rashes or bumps accompanying the itching?
Yes, I have linear urticaria on my upper back that develops after gentle scratching.
Do you have any known allergies or have you had similar skin issues in the past?
No, I don't have any known allergies and I haven't had similar skin issues in the past.
Has anyone in your family had similar symptoms or any other chronic skin conditions?
I don't know of any family members who have had similar symptoms or chronic skin conditions.
Are you currently taking any medications or have you recently started any new medication?
I am not taking any medications other than multivitamins.
Final Diagnosis: Dermatographia
